thread.title: Flight delays pile up as United Airlines grounds all planes
thread.title_full: Flight delays pile up as United Airlines grounds all planes

title: Flight delays pile up as United Airlines grounds all planes
text:
Tim Boyle | Bloomberg ​Flight delays pile up in Dayton and around the country as United Airlines grounds all… more Flight delays pile up in Dayton and around the country as United Airlines grounds all planes. The Federal Aviation Administration has said United grounded all flights after a computer glitch occurred. It wasn't known how long it would take the get the " automation issue " fixed. "We're working to resolve the issue with the passenger service system and apologize for the inconvenience," United tweeted from its Twitter account in response to one passenger's complaint. Related: Click here to see the airlines with the most passenger complaints. Already, several flights into and out of Dayton International Airport are listed as delayed on the airport's flight status site . Dozens of United flights are scheduled for today in Dayton that are still listed for their regular time later today. It is not yet known if the delays this morning will push those flights into delays as well, but that may depend on how long it takes to fix the computer glitch. Many other flight delays are piling up at other airports around the country. United Airlines is the second-busiest carrier flying out of the Dayton International Airport. The Chicago-based airline flew roughly 225,000 local passengers last year, according to the DBJ Book of the Lists . United saw its Dayton traffic drop 4.5 percent in May to about 18,100 passengers for the month compared to the same month last year.
